IMPLEMENTATION.md.summary: Comprehensive product vision and technical specification document for Atlas, an AI-powered developer onboarding tool that analyzes codebases and creates guided walkthroughs.
responsibilities: Define product vision and core features
Specify API endpoints and data flow
IMPLEMENTATION.md.onboarding_reason: Essential reading to understand the overall product goals, feature set, and how all system components work together.

backend/.graph_cache/e530f1213197.json.summary: Cached graph data for a previously analyzed repository, containing file lists, dependency edges, AI-generated file analyses, and onboarding path.
responsibilities: Enable fast re-loading of analyzed repos
backend/.graph_cache/e530f1213197.json.onboarding_reason: Example of cached data structure but not critical for understanding core application logic.

backend/auth.py.summary: Authentication module providing user signup/login, JWT token management, and GitHub OAuth integration for secure API access.
backend/auth.py.onboarding_reason: Important for understanding how the system secures API access and manages user sessions.

backend/config.py.summary: Central configuration module defining API keys, file processing settings, chunking parameters, and application constants used throughout the backend.
backend/config.py.onboarding_reason: Critical for understanding system parameters, dependencies, and how the application is configured.

backend/database.py.summary: Database connection setup and User model definition using SQLAlchemy for PostgreSQL, including basic schema migration support.
backend/database.py.onboarding_reason: Important for understanding data persistence but relatively straightforward database setup.

backend/embeddings.py.summary: Embedding and vector storage layer using OpenAI embeddings and ChromaDB for semantic search over code chunks during Q&A.
backend/embeddings.py.onboarding_reason: Core component for the RAG-powered Q&A feature - essential for understanding how semantic search works.

backend/llm.py.summary: Claude LLM integration for generating answers with citations, analyzing file importance scores, and creating onboarding paths through codebases.
backend/llm.py.onboarding_reason: Critical component that powers the AI features - file analysis, Q&A, and guided onboarding paths.

backend/main.py.summary: FastAPI application entry point that defines all API endpoints, orchestrates the ingestion pipeline, and coordinates between all backend components.
backend/main.py.onboarding_reason: Main entry point that shows how all backend components work together - start here to understand the complete API surface.

backend/parser.py.summary: Repository processing module that clones Git repos, walks file trees, chunks code into overlapping segments, and extracts import dependencies.
backend/parser.py.onboarding_reason: Core ingestion pipeline component that transforms raw repositories into processable data structures.

backend/requirements.txt.summary: Python package dependencies including FastAPI, ChromaDB, OpenAI, Anthropic, GitPython and other libraries needed for the backend.
backend/requirements.txt.onboarding_reason: Useful for understanding the technology stack but not critical for understanding application logic.

backend/run.py.summary: Development server launcher using uvicorn with hot reload configured to exclude cache directories from file watching.
backend/run.py.onboarding_reason: Simple development utility - shows how to run the server but not essential for understanding core functionality.

frontend/README.md.summary: Standard Vite + React template documentation explaining available plugins, React Compiler, and ESLint configuration options.
frontend/README.md.onboarding_reason: Generic template documentation that doesn't provide insight into the actual Atlas application features.

frontend/eslint.config.js.summary: ESLint configuration file for React project with JSX support. Sets up recommended rules for React hooks and hot refresh.
responsibilities: Configure ESLint rules for React development
Set up parser options for JSX and modern JavaScript
Define code quality and style enforcement rules
frontend/eslint.config.js.onboarding_reason: Standard tooling configuration that new developers should understand for code quality standards.

frontend/index.html.summary: Main HTML entry point for the React application. Defines the root element and loads the main JavaScript module.
responsibilities: Serve as the single HTML entry point
Define viewport and basic meta tags
Load the main React application script
frontend/index.html.onboarding_reason: Critical entry point that new developers should understand as it bootstraps the entire frontend application.

frontend/package-lock.json.summary: Auto-generated lock file that pins exact dependency versions for consistent builds.
responsibilities: Lock dependency versions for reproducible builds
frontend/package-lock.json.onboarding_reason: Generated file that doesn't need to be read by new developers.

frontend/package.json.summary: NPM package configuration defining project dependencies, scripts, and metadata for a React/Vite frontend.
responsibilities: Define project dependencies and dev dependencies
Set project metadata and module type
frontend/package.json.onboarding_reason: Important for understanding project structure, available commands, and key dependencies like React Flow and React Router.

frontend/src/App.jsx.summary: Main application component that orchestrates authentication, routing, and the core dashboard functionality. Handles repository ingestion workflow and component coordination.
responsibilities: Manage application routing between login and dashboard
Orchestrate repository ingestion process with real-time updates
Coordinate state between graph, chat, and source panels
Handle authentication flow and protected routes
frontend/src/App.jsx.onboarding_reason: Critical entry point that new developers must understand as it contains the main application logic and state management.

frontend/src/auth.jsx.summary: Authentication context provider that manages user login state, token storage, and provides auth utilities throughout the app.
responsibilities: Manage authentication state and token persistence
Generate authorization headers for API requests
frontend/src/auth.jsx.onboarding_reason: Core authentication system that new developers need to understand for implementing protected features and API calls.

frontend/src/components/ChatPanel.jsx.summary: Interactive chat interface for querying repositories with AI assistance. Displays conversation history and handles citation links.
responsibilities: Manage chat conversation state and message history
Send queries to backend and display AI responses
Render citation links as clickable elements
Handle loading states and error messages
frontend/src/components/ChatPanel.jsx.onboarding_reason: Important component for understanding the AI query functionality and how citations are integrated with other panels.

frontend/src/components/GraphPanel.jsx.summary: Interactive dependency graph visualization using React Flow. Displays repository structure with file importance scoring and highlighting.
responsibilities: Render interactive node graph of repository files
Handle file highlighting based on citations or selections
Implement custom layout algorithm for file organization
Provide tooltips with file metadata and importance scores
frontend/src/components/GraphPanel.jsx.onboarding_reason: Key component that visualizes repository structure and is central to the user experience of understanding codebases.

frontend/src/components/IngestBar.jsx.summary: Simple input form component for entering repository URLs to begin the analysis process.
responsibilities: Provide URL input interface for repository ingestion
frontend/src/components/IngestBar.jsx.onboarding_reason: Simple UI component that handles the initial user input for repository analysis.

frontend/src/components/IngestProgress.j.summary: Progress indicator component that shows real-time status during repository analysis with step-by-step visualization.
responsibilities: Display multi-step progress during repository ingestion
Show current step status with visual indicators
Provide user feedback during long-running operations
frontend/src/components/IngestProgress.j.onboarding_reason: Important for understanding the repository analysis workflow and providing user feedback during processing.

frontend/src/components/OnboardingWalkth.summary: Step-by-step guided walkthrough component that helps users understand repository structure through curated file exploration.
responsibilities: Fetch and display onboarding steps from backend
Navigate through curated file exploration sequence
Highlight relevant files in the graph panel
Display file summaries and key information
frontend/src/components/OnboardingWalkth.onboarding_reason: Core feature component that implements the guided onboarding experience for repository exploration.

frontend/src/components/RepoChooser.jsx.summary: Repository selection interface that displays user's GitHub repositories with metadata for easy selection.
responsibilities: Fetch and display user's GitHub repositories
Show repository metadata like language and last update
frontend/src/components/RepoChooser.jsx.onboarding_reason: Important component for understanding how users select repositories and the GitHub integration workflow.

frontend/src/components/SourcePanel.jsx.summary: A React component that displays source code with line numbers in a syntax-highlighted panel. It shows file location and provides a close button.
responsibilities: Render source code lines with line numbers
Display file path and line range information
Provide close functionality for the panel
Handle code display formatting and styling
frontend/src/components/SourcePanel.jsx.onboarding_reason: Read this to understand how source code is displayed in the UI when users click on code references.

frontend/src/index.css.summary: Global CSS styles that imports Tailwind CSS and sets basic body styling with dark theme colors. Defines the overall visual foundation.
responsibilities: Set global body styles and dark theme
Define base typography with Inter font
frontend/src/index.css.onboarding_reason: Skim this to understand the global styling approach and dark theme setup, but it's just basic CSS configuration.

frontend/src/main.jsx.summary: The main entry point for the React application that renders the App component into the DOM. This is where the frontend application starts.
responsibilities: Mount the App component to the DOM
Serve as the application entry point
frontend/src/main.jsx.onboarding_reason: This is the critical entry point - read this first to understand how the React app is initialized and bootstrapped.

frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.jsx.summary: A React page component that handles user authentication with email/password login and GitHub OAuth. Manages login state and navigation.
responsibilities: Manage authentication state and error handling
frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.jsx.onboarding_reason: Read this to understand how user authentication works and the login flow in the application.

frontend/src/pages/SignupPage.jsx.summary: A React page component that handles user registration with email/password signup and GitHub OAuth. Similar to LoginPage but for creating new accounts.
responsibilities: Navigate users after successful account creation
frontend/src/pages/SignupPage.jsx.onboarding_reason: Read this to understand the user registration flow, which complements the login system.

frontend/vite.config.js.summary: Vite configuration file that sets up the build tool with React plugin, Tailwind CSS, and proxy rules for backend API routes.
responsibilities: Configure Vite build tool with React support
Define proxy rules for backend API endpoints
frontend/vite.config.js.onboarding_reason: Review this to understand the build setup and how frontend API calls are proxied to the backend during development.
